title: Altmann (mountain)
text:
The Altmann is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="Appenzell%20Alps">Appenzell Alps</a>, located on the border between the cantons of <a href="Appenzell%20Innerrhoden">Appenzell Innerrhoden</a> and <a href="Canton%20of%20St.%20Gallen">St. Gallen</a>. It is situated in the massif of the <a href="Alpstein">Alpstein</a> north of <a href="Wildhaus">Wildhaus</a> (St. Gallen), a few kilometres from the <a href="S%C3%A4ntis">Säntis</a>.
The Altmann is a steep limestone tower, which rises about 1000 metres over the valleys of the Alpstein. The normal route starts at Rotsteinpass (2,120 metres) on the north-west side and is considered an easy climb.
